descriptions.description: More core developers increase mentorship, accelerating the promotion of new core developers. This reinforcing loop creates exponential growth in the core team's size and capacity.

Core developers mentor others, increasing the skilled contributor pool and accelerating promotions. This reinforcing loop amplifies the project's overall experience and development velocity over time.
A higher promotion rate depletes the pool of experienced contributors, which in turn slows the promotion rate. This balancing loop seeks equilibrium in the contributor hierarchy.
As new contributors gain skills, they leave the 'new' pool, slowing the overall skill-up rate. This balancing loop regulates the growth of inexperienced contributors.
An increase in core developers leads to higher turnover, which then reduces the number of core developers. This balancing loop stabilizes the core team size against attrition.
